Docs.summary: Extensions for statically typed bag of wordhash converter.

<Extension()> Public Function ToBagofHashedWords (input As Scalar(Of String), Optional hashBits As Integer = 16, Optional ngramLength As Integer = 1, Optional skipLength As Integer = 0, Optional allLengths As Boolean = true, Optional seed As UInteger = 314489979, Optional ordered As Boolean = true, Optional invertHash As Integer = 0) As Vector(Of Single)
static member ToBagofHashedWords : Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Scalar<string> * int * int * int * bool * uint32 * bool * int -> Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Vector<single>
MemberSignature.Usage: Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.WordHashBagEstimatorStaticExtensions.ToBagofHashedWords (input, hashBits, ngramLength, skipLength, allLengths, seed, ordered, invertHash)

Docs.param: Number of bits to hash into. Must be between 1 and 30, inclusive.
Maximum number of tokens to skip when constructing an ngram.
Whether to include all ngram lengths up to or only .
Whether the position of each source column should be included in the hash (when there are multiple source columns).

During hashing we constuct mappings between original values and the produced hash values. Text representation of original values are stored in the slot names of the metadata for the new column.Hashing, as such, can map many initial values to one. specifies the upper bound of the number of distinct input values mapping to a hash that should be retained. 0 does not retain any input values. -1 retains all input values mapping to each hash.
Docs.summary: Produces a bag of counts of ngrams (sequences of consecutive words of length 1-n) in a given text. It does so by hashing each ngram and using the hash value as the index in the bag.
